sect3.title: Kernel Configuration
sect3.para: Enable the following options in the kernel configuration and recompile the kernel if necessary:

screen.literal: Device Drivers ---> Graphics support ---> Nouveau (nVidia) cards: Y or M Support for backlight control: Y

sect3.title: Glamor Acceleration
sect3.para: Glamor is an acceleration library which uses cards' 3D capabilities to accelerate 2D rendering. Glamor acceleration is enabled by default for the new Maxwell GPU's. According to the documentation, Glamor acceleration can be used with other chips as well, but that does not seem functional yet.
To enable Glamor for GPU's other than the new Maxwell ones, create the following file as the root user:

screen.userinput: cat >> /etc/X11/xorg.conf.d/nvidia.conf << "EOF" Section "Device" Identifier "nvidia" Driver "nouveau" Option "AccelMethod" "glamor" EndSection EOF

listitem.para: is an Xorg video driver for nVidia video cards.
